articles.title: WPK Delegation Leaves for UK and Greece
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Leaves for UK and Greece

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Ri Yong Chol, vice department director of its Central Committee, left here Friday to visit the UK and Greece.
					
					 Meanwhile, arriving was a delegation of the Delegation of the European External Action Service headed by Seamus Gillespie, acting director for Asian Affairs.

articles.title: UMNO Secretary General Meets WPK Delegation
articles.content:
UMNO Secretary General Meets WPK Delegation

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- We hope that the relations and cooperation between the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia and the Workers' Party of Korea would grow stronger.
					
					 Datuk Seri Tengku Adnan Tengku Mansor, secretary general of the Organization, said this on Nov. 28 when meeting with the WPK delegation led by Ri Chang Gun, vice department director of its Central Committee, attending the Congress of his Organization.
					
					 The WPK delegation's participation in the Congress proves that the relations between the two parties are getting closer, he said.
					
					 We are glad to see the WPK and the Korean people making great achievements while overcoming difficulties, he added.
					
					 The secretary general expressed belief that the WPK and the Korean people would build a thriving nation under the wise guidance of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Agricultural Symposium on Rotation Production System Held
articles.content:
Agricultural Symposium on Rotation Production System Held

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- An agricultural symposium on rotation production system took place at the People's Palace of Culture from Nov. 29 to Dec. 2 under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					
					 Attending it were scientists, technicians and officials in the field of agriculture, including grain production, stockbreeding, pomiculture and sericulture, from across the country.
					
					 The symposium heard speeches on technical problems arising in the establishment of rotation production system in stockbreeding and grain output, the method of producing organic composite fertilizer and so forth.
					
					 Speakers referred to successes gained by many units in the country through a bold and large-scale drive to establish the rotation production system. 
					
					 There were a public presentation of scientific and technological papers and an exhibition of agricultural technological products during the symposium.
					
					 Of the papers submitted, more than 200 data on success achieved in scientific research and technical updating were made public and 80 odd kinds of new technological products displayed.
					
					 There were also brisk dissemination of science and technology and exchange of new technologies and visits to exemplary units on the sidelines of the seminar.

articles.title: Koreans Harden Determination to Defeat Any Provocation
articles.content:
Koreans Harden Determination to Defeat Any Provocation

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The DPRK revolutionary armed forces are in full readiness to go into a decisive battle to counter any military provocation -- this is what the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army (KPA) declared in its report released on November 24 in response to the military exercise launched by the south Korean military against the DPRK.
					
					 Upon receiving the report, DPRK servicepersons and civilians have hardened their determination to defeat any military provocation by the south Korean military seeking confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the DPRK. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun, Minju Joson and other major newspapers of the DPRK allot much space to articles criticizing the south Korean military for launching the large-scale war exercise, instead of drawing due lesson from the Yonphyong Island shelling a year ago.
					
					 TV channels have repeatedly telecasted a documentary film about a joint exercise of the three services of the KPA.
					
					 The film gives a glimpse of the might of the KPA and inspires local people with confidence in victory in battles with the enemy.
					
					 Seen in industrial establishments, co-op farms and construction sites throughout the country are bulletin boards calling for working hard in the spirit of fighting the enemy.

articles.title: Chongchun Street
articles.content:
Chongchun Street

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Chongchun Street in Pyongyang has comprehensive sports and welfare service facilities.  
					
					The street was built in Juche 77 (1988) under the deep care of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il for the country's sports development.
					
					  The sports facilities are enough to host more than 20 events simultaneously.
					
					 The Sports Science Library was built in the street in 2009. 
					
					Sosan Football Stadium has been rebuilt and the Kumkop (gold cup) Combined Foodstuff Factory was constructed for sportspersons. 
					
					 A Taekwon-Do complex consisting of a Taekwon-Do center, field training ground and research institute is under construction in a large area near Taekwon-Do Hall.
					
					 The Chongchun Street plays a big role in developing sports techniques and promoting people's health.

articles.title: S. Korea's Tightened Alliance with US Will Never Help
articles.content:
S. Korea's Tightened Alliance with US Will Never Help

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The DPRK leading newspaper Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article Friday said the south Korean authorities' tightened alliance with foreign forces will invite nothing but curse and denunciation from the nation. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities' moves to tighten "alliance" with foreign forces are an act of treachery little short of selling off the dignity and interests of the people, bedeviling the north-south relations and bringing the danger of a war to the Korean Peninsula, the article said, adding:
					
					 The south Korean group of conservatives said the alliance would bring benefit to south Korea but it is nothing but flamboyant rhetoric aimed to cover its treacherous true colors. 
					
					 The south Korean ruling forces not only accepted all the requests its American master raised as for the passage of the "Free Trade Agreement" but also justified it, saying it is for tightened "economic alliance". He even pledged to "work hard for the interests of the United States."
					
					 Lurking behind this is its ulterior purpose to maintain power and serve out full term without trouble even by currying favor and supporting its master at the sacrifice of the interests of the south Korean people. 
					
					 The group of conservatives' tightened alliance with the U.S. is also aimed to escalate the policy for confrontation with the DPRK being backed by its master. 
					
					 As long as the south Korean authorities keep tightening alliance with the U.S. and intensifying the anti-DPRK conspiracy while paying no heed to their fellow countrymen, it is impossible to improve north-south relations nor is it possible to remove the danger of the outbreak of a nuclear war from the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 South Korea's intensified moves for alliance with the U.S. will disclose its nature as traitors. They will never be able to escape doom, sternly pushed by the angered people.

articles.title: Minju Joson Hits Railroaded "Motion for FTA Ratification"
articles.content:
Minju Joson Hits Railroaded "Motion for FTA Ratification"

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korea-U.S. "Free Trade Agreement" is little different from a sentence of death to the south Korean people, says Minju Joson Friday in a bylined commentary.
					
					 The agreement is run through with humiliating and treacherous contents that serve to deepen the U.S. colonial rule and subjugation over south Korea, the commentary says, adding:
					
					 It is not the popular masses of south Korea but the foreign forces and its conservative "government" servile to them and a tiny handful of big businessmen that will get benefits from effectuation of the FTA.
					
					 The point at issue is the reason why the "Grand National Party" railroaded the "motion calling for ratification of FTA" even though it presupposed massive protest of the people.
					
					 As is known, the GNP is now at a serious crisis. Growing stronger is the demand of the popular masses for the punishment of the conservative "government" which has engaged itself in traitorous policy, swimming against the public voice. In the meantime bloody strife is going on almost every day among factions of the GNP under the signboard of "reform" after its defeat in the Seoul mayoral election. After all, the GNP will have no shelter to depend on, if it is forsaken by its U.S. master. Since, the GNP group of traitors railroaded the "motion" through the "National Assembly" in an ulterior intention to tide over the ruling crisis and stay in power with the support of the U.S.
					
					 As long as the group of traitors steeped in pro-American sycophancy to its marrow stay in power, the south Korean people can never be freed from the outsiders' domination and subjugation, but face bitterer misery and disaster.

articles.title: Ceaseless Candlelight Rally in S. Korea
articles.content:
Ceaseless Candlelight Rally in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- A candlelight rally was held in Seoul on Nov. 29 in protest against the conclusion of the shackling "Free Trade Agreement" with the U.S., south Korean MBC reported.
					
					 The ralliers deplored that the FTA would bring big disasters to the south Korean people.
					
					 They urged the authorities to stop the conclusion of the FTA at once.
					
					 At the rally the Headquarters of the All-People Movement for Checking the Conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. FTA declared that it would continue the candlelight rally.

articles.title: Declaration on Stand against FTA Made Public in S. Korea
articles.content:
Declaration on Stand against FTA Made Public in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Headquarters of the All-People Movement for Checking the Conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement called a press conference on Nov. 30 to make public a declaration opposing the shackling FTA, south Korean MBC reported. The declaration was signed by 5,000 people from all walks of life including members of civic and public organizations, opposition party members and students.
					
					 The declaration said that the unequal FTA with the U.S. should be cancelled at once.
					
					 The authorities cracked down with water cannons down the protesters demanding nullification of the "motion for the ratification of FTA" which was railroaded by the "Grand National Party", it charged.
					
					 It called upon all the people to rise up in the large-scale action for nullifying the motion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Peruvian Internet Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Peruvian Internet Website

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship posted leader Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is What Keeps Our People Alive" on its Internet homepage on Nov. 26.
					
					 The work, published on Nov. 14, Juche 81 (1992), clarifies the necessity to defend the world socialist movement at present and the tasks and ways for advancing the socialist cause.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il, Defender of Socialism: Nepali Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il, Defender of Socialism: Nepali Paper

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Nepali paper Jana Sata on Nov. 26 carried a special write-up under the title of "Defender of Socialism" with a photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il on the 20th anniversary of his assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 This year marks the 20th anniversary of his assumption of the supreme commandership of the KPA in the DPRK, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists brought the nuclear crisis to the Korean Peninsula to stifle the DPRK and staged Team Spirit joint military exercises, a large-scale nuclear test war, in March 1993.
					
					 Kim Jong Il visited the military post of shrub pine trees on Jan. 1, 1995. This was like a solemn declaration of his will to defend socialism to the last under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 He has energetically led the work to strengthen the politico-ideological and military-technical might of the KPA in every way and remarkably develop the defence industry.
					
					 The DPRK came to secure the reliable war deterrent under his leadership.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk's Praised by Mexican Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk's Praised by Mexican Organization

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism released the 64th issue of its bulletin to mark the 94th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 The bulletin carried a photo of the woman commander of Mt. Paektu and an article which said:
					
					 Kim Jong Suk is a prominent revolutionary who devoted all her life to the social emancipation of the Korean women and the development of the women's movement.
					
					 Many women grew up to be admirable revolutionaries under the guidance of her who took part in the great anti-Japanese war commanded by President Kim Il Sung in her early years to establish her fame as an anti-Japanese war hero and a woman commander of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 After the liberation of Korea she positively aided the President, encouraging the women to turn out as one in building a new society.
					
					 She showed deep care for the work to build up the Democratic Women's Union of Korea and rally broad sections of women around the union.
					
					 Her noble feats for the emancipation of women and the women's movement are shining long with socialist Korea always emerging victorious.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Developing Literature in Army
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Developing Literature in Army

					 Beijing, December 1 (KCNA) -- Xu Caihou, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of China, called for enhancing the role of military officials of literature and arts.
					
					 Speaking at a recent meeting with military officials participating in the Ninth National Congress of the China Federation of Literature and Art Circles and the Eighth National Congress of the Chinese Writers' Association, Xu said they should serve as the main force in widely disseminating the advanced military culture and scouts in developing socialist culture.
					
					 All Communist Party committees should strengthen guidance over the literary and art activities of the army, train able personnel and provide good conditions for developing literature and arts in the army, the vice-chairman added.

articles.title: Technical Innovation Urged in China
articles.content:
Technical Innovation Urged in China

					 Beijing, December 1 (KCNA) ? A Chinese vice-premier called for promoting technical innovation in the country.
					
					 Addressing a national meeting on technical innovation held in Beijing some days ago, Zhang Dejiang underscored the need to take a scientific approach to development and boost investment in technical innovation. 
					
					 It is also necessary to increase the technical innovation capabilities, train talented persons and carry on activities for technical innovation in a voluntary, positive and active way, thereby making a bigger contribution to developing the industry in a scientific way, he added.

articles.title: China Discusses Measures of Cultural System Reform
articles.content:
China Discusses Measures of Cultural System Reform

					 Beijing, December 1 (KCNA) -- A meeting of national guidance groups for reform of the cultural system took place in Beijing some days ago.
					
					 The meeting discussed measures to implement the decision of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on major issues arising in attaining a great development and prosperity of socialist culture.
					
					 It underscored the need to properly set the target and main tasks for a bigger stride in cultural development.

articles.title: Chinese Gov't Pays Importance to Women, Children
articles.content:
Chinese Gov't Pays Importance to Women, Children

					 Beijing, December 1 (KCNA) -- The 5th national meeting on the work for women and children was held in Beijing on Sunday.
					
					 Addressing the meeting, Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao called on governments at all levels to include the work for women and children in the general plans for socio-economic development and public policies, strengthen guidance over the work and increase investment in it.
					
					 All social strata should pay close attention to the work and make society replete with the good habit of respecting women and protecting children, the premier said.

articles.title: China Launches Satellite
articles.content:
China Launches Satellite

					 Beijing, December 1 (KCNA) -- China successfully launched remote detection satellite-13 into its preset orbit.
					
					 Carrier rocket Changzheng-2 with the satellite atop blasted off from the Taiyuan Satellite Launching Center on November 30.
					
					 The satellite will be used for scientific experiment, survey of land resources, prevention of natural disasters and other purposes.

articles.title: Chinese Defense Ministry on Trial Voyage of Aircraft Carrier
articles.content:
Chinese Defense Ministry on Trial Voyage of Aircraft Carrier

					 Beijing, December 1 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the Chinese Defense Ministry referred to the trial voyage of aircraft carrier at a press conference on November 30.
					
					 The carrier set sail on a trial basis in China on November 29, the spokesperson said, voicing hope that all the countries would take reasonable and objective stand to it as it was a regular voyage under a plan.
					
					 Aircraft carrier building requires testing of various armed equipment, facilities and parts as it involves complicated system processes, the spokesperson said, adding the timeline and contents of the test will be confirmed on the basis of comprehensive research and building processes.

articles.title: Intensified Social Management Urged in China
articles.content:
Intensified Social Management Urged in China

					 Beijing, December 1 (KCNA) -- A Chinese vice-premier called for providing happiness to the local people with intensified management of society.
					
					 Speaking at a round-table meeting held in Yichang City, Hubei Province some days ago, Hui Liangyu underscored the need for all regions and sectors concerned to fully understand the importance and urgency of the policy and instructions of the leadership for intensifying and innovating social management and take detailed and realistic measures to that effect.
					
					 "In particular, efforts should be channeled into settling problems affecting the harmony and stability of society," he added.

articles.title: CSTO Proposes Joint Anti-drug Combat
articles.content:
CSTO Proposes Joint Anti-drug Combat

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Collective Security Treaty Organization (CSTO) recently called upon its member nations to expand cooperation in the anti-drug combat and launch a joint action for prevention and treatment of drug addiction. 
					
					 The deputy secretary of CSTO said cooperation in this work will lead to the information and experience exchange and the establishment of a cooperative organization.

articles.title: Russia Intensifies Combat against Terrorism
articles.content:
Russia Intensifies Combat against Terrorism

					 Moscow, December 1 (KCNA) -- Russia has registered successes in combating terrorism in North Caucasus Region. 
					
					 More than 300 terrorists were annihilated, over 100 terrorist bases destroyed and a lot of weapons seized in the region this year, according to a recent report by the General Bureau for the North Caucasus Federal District of the Russian Ministry of Interior.

articles.title: Russia Takes Measures against US MD
articles.content:
Russia Takes Measures against US MD

					 Moscow, December 1 (KCNA) -- Russia set off taking steps to cope with the U.S. moves to deploy the missile defense system in Europe.
					
					 A radar station in Kaliningrad Region recently entered into combat duty earlier than planned.
					
					 Touching on this, Russian President Dmitri Medvedev noted that this long-range radar station is included in the missile attack early warning system.
					
					 He ordered the Ministry of Defense to settle all the problems needed for operating the station.

articles.title: Russia Sees No Reasons for NATO Involvement in Arctic Affairs
articles.content:
Russia Sees No Reasons for NATO Involvement in Arctic Affairs

					 Moscow, December 1 (KCNA) -- There is no reason for NATO to become involved in any potential conflicts in the Arctic, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said to reporters Tuesday.
					
					 Lavrov reiterated that Russia also saw no reason to expect conflicts in the Arctic region.
					
					 "We see no idea of military actions in the Arctic. There is a consensus among the Arctic Council members that all problems which might arise in the region must be settled within the framework of the council and on the base of the UN conventions," he said.

articles.title: Russia Calls for Asia-Pacific Security Cooperation System
articles.content:
Russia Calls for Asia-Pacific Security Cooperation System

					 Moscow, December 1 (KCNA) -- A senior Russian diplomat said the proposal of Russia and China for the establishment of a comprehensive security cooperation system in the Asia-Pacific region is being carried into practice gradually.
					
					 Speaking at a recent press interview, Aleksei Borodavkin, a vice foreign minister, said the essence of this proposal is that nations are related to each other in security as they are faced with international challenges.
					
					 For the implementation of the proposal, it should be confirmed that all nations are faithful to the principle of a peaceful solution to disputes and the principle of refraining from using arms and threatening other nations with arms, Borodavkin added.

articles.title: Russian FM Slams NATO's Air Strike at Pakistan's Border
articles.content:
Russian FM Slams NATO's Air Strike at Pakistan's Border Post

					 Moscow, December 1 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, in a telephone conversation with his Pakistani counterpart on Monday, criticized NATO for its air strike at a border post of Pakistan.
					
					 A down-to-earth investigation of the incident should be made and state sovereignty should not be abused in the anti-terrorism operation, he added.

articles.title: More than 1 in 5 Americans Economically Insecure
articles.content:
More than 1 in 5 Americans Economically Insecure

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Many families of the U.S. are finding it hard to make living due to the unpopular policies of the authorities and the aftermath of serous economic crisis.
					
					 More than one in five Americans saw their available household income decline by a quarter or more in the past three years, according to the results of the opinion poll released by a public organization of the country on Monday.

articles.title: Japan's Unemployment Rate Rises to 4.5% in October
articles.content:
Japan's Unemployment Rate Rises to 4.5% in October

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Japan's unemployment rate rose to 4.5 percent in October from 4.1 percent in September for the first deterioration in three months, reflecting the poor employment conditions persisting in the country.
					
					 The number of the unemployed was up by 250,000, or 9.4 percent, to 2.92 million, according to an official at the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications.

articles.title: Crimes in Japan and Australia
articles.content:
Crimes in Japan and Australia

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Police in Oita Prefecture in southwestern Japan arrested a 37-year-old woman on Saturday on suspicion of beating her 4-year-old son to death.
					
					 More than 200 kilograms of illicit drugs has been seized in Sydney, authorities said on Tuesday.
					
					 The AFP said the 216 kg of drugs included 97.7 kg of heroin and 118.4 kg of pseudoephedrine.

articles.title: Natural Disasters in Different Countries
articles.content:
Natural Disasters in Different Countries

					Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Authorities are assisting over 66,000 people displaced in a spate of storms that hit Sri Lanka's southern coastline and repairing 1,000km of power cables damaged, officials said on Tuesday.
					
					 Strong storms battered four districts in the island nation for four days last week killing 22 people, said Pradeep Kodippili, assistant director of the Disaster Management Center.
					
					 Over 40 people are reported to be missing and feared dead as storms racked the coastal belt towards the southern part of the country.
					
					 The government continues to take relief measures.
					
					Storms also hit Sweden on November 28, cutting electricity supply to 80,000 residents and forcing the airline service to come offline.
					
					 The northern region of New South Wales State, Australia suffered flood damage by the recent days of heavy rains.
					
					 Roads, bridges and other major substructures were destroyed.
					
					 The government included the region in the list of disaster-stricken regions on November 29.

articles.title: Cooperation among Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Different Countries

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Pakistan and Iran on Monday agreed to bolster regional cooperation to combat drug smuggling.
					
					 On Nov. 25 Russia and Belarus signed agreements on gas import and export, the plan for building nuclear power plant.

articles.title: Iran Rejects West's Threat
articles.content:
Iran Rejects West's Threat

					 Tehran, December 1 (KCNA) -- The minister of Oil of Iran on Nov. 27 rejected the West's threat against his country.
					
					 The minister said that West's sanctions against Iran's oil industry will cause problems for the global oil market.
					
					 The minister added that buyers will not find an alternative to the Iranian oil with the same quality.
					
					 The minister noted that significant buyers of its oil are from other regions rather than West.

articles.title: Indonesia Calls for Int'l Support to Palestinian Cause
articles.content:
Indonesia Calls for Int'l Support to Palestinian Cause

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Indonesia on Tuesday called on the international community to offer their strong support to the Palestinian efforts.
					
					 Triyono Wibowo, Indonesian permanent representative to the United Nations, made the statement as he was speaking at a meeting of the UN General Assembly to mark the International Day of Solidarity with the Palestinian People, which falls on Nov. 29.
					
					 "Indonesia remains committed to the pursuit of an independent, viable and democratic Palestine," Wibowo said. 
					
					 "In our view, if Israel truly wishes to resolve the conflict with Palestine, she must respond by determining that it must work within the dictates of international rule, and not its own narrow interests," he said.
					
					 "All parties must show the necessary leadership, courage and responsibility that will enable them to arrive at a mutually agreeable and lasting peace that would resolve all final status issues," he added.

articles.title: M5.1 Quake Rocks E. Indonesia
articles.content:
M5.1 Quake Rocks E. Indonesia

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- A moderate earthquake measuring 5. 1 on the Richter scale rocked eastern Indonesia of North Maluku province, the Meteorology, Climatology and Geophysics Agency said Tuesday.
					
					 The tremor was centered at 80 kilometers southwest of Labuha city and at a depth of 10 kilometers under seabed.

articles.title: Bird Flu Confirmed among Ducks in Vietnam
articles.content:
Bird Flu Confirmed among Ducks in Vietnam

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Avian influenza has been recently confirmed among ducks in a stock-breeding farm in Dac Lac Province, Vietnam.
					
					 Ducks were tested to have been infected with the H5N1-type bird flu, the Vietnamese government said on November 29.
					
					 The farm disposed of ducks and their eggs and disinfected the farm and its surrounding area as part of measures to prevent the spread of the disease.

articles.title: Brazilian President Inaugurates First Petrobras Produced Oil Tanker
articles.content:
Brazilian President Inaugurates First Petrobras Produced Oil Tanker

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff on Friday inaugurated a domestically produced oil tanker for state-controlled oil and gas giant Petrobras.
					
					The 183-meter-long Celso Furtado can carry a payload of 56 million liters of oil. 
					
					 According to Petrobras, Celso Furtado will be used to transport Petrobras' products in Brazilian waters.

articles.title: Palestinians Rally in Gaza for Prisoners in Israeli Jails
articles.content:
Palestinians Rally in Gaza for Prisoners in Israeli Jails

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Dozens of Palestinian prisoners' family members demonstrated Tuesday in the Khan Younis city in southern Gaza Strip to protest the deteriorating conditions in the Israeli jails.
					
					 The demonstrators waved Palestinian flags and posters of the prisoners, and chanted slogans against the Israeli Prisons Services' policies against the Palestinian prisoners.
					
					 They called for the release of all the Palestinian prisoners from all Israeli jails.

articles.title: Non-Aligned Movement Knocks Israeli Settlement Activity
articles.content:
Non-Aligned Movement Knocks Israeli Settlement Activity

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Non-Aligned Movement on Tuesday slammed Israel's settlement activity in the occupied Palestinian territory, saying Israel's pattern of "provocative" action in the West Bank is a sign. 
					
					 The statement came as the Egyptian permanent representative to the United Nations, Maged Abdel Aziz, was speaking on behalf of the 120 members of the Non-Aligned Movement (NAM), at the UN General Assembly to mark the International Day of Solidarity with the Palestinian People.
					
					 Israel is continuing to deliberately obstruct the attainment of peace and security in the Middle East region, Aziz said.
					
					 The Non-Aligned Movement remains firm in its condemnation of Israel's illegal settlement policies and practices, stressing that all such unlawful attempts to alter the demographic composition, character and status of the Occupied Palestinian Territory, including East Jerusalem, remain rejected and unrecognized by the international community," Aziz said.

articles.title: Israeli Naval Forces Escalate Measures against Gaza Fishermen
articles.content:
Israeli Naval Forces Escalate Measures against Gaza Fishermen

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Israeli naval commandos have escalated its measures against the fishermen near the northern shores of the Gaza Strip, officials said on Tuesday.
					
					 The Israeli naval forces arrested on Nov. 28 and 29 11 Gaza fishermen while they were fishing in the sea in northern Gaza Strip and seized the six boats.
					
					 This has sparked strong protest and condemnation by the international community.

articles.title: Swiss Official: Negotiations Only Solution to Iran’s Nuclear Issue
articles.content:
Swiss Official: Negotiations Only Solution to Iran’s Nuclear Issue

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Ivan Shawvaker who is a spokesperson for the Green Party of Switzerland said in an exclusive interview with IRNA on Friday that the new sanctions imposed on Iran by certain western countries will just make the situation more convulsive, having no other effect. 
					
					 He termed as wrong any decision to issue more anti-Iran sanctions.
					
					 He stressed that contrary to the U.S., which has waged numerous wars across the world, Iran is a peaceful country being engaged in no war with any other country.

articles.title: Two Million British Workers Walk off Job
articles.content:
Two Million British Workers Walk off Job

					 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- More than 1,000 demonstrations have been organized across the UK. Two million public sector workers in Britain have gone on strike over changes to their pensions in the biggest walkout for decades, which is expected to cause widespread disruption.
					
					 They took to the streets denouncing the authorities for the austerity measures which worsen the living conditions of the workers under the pretext of easing economic crisis.
					
					 Three-quarters of schools were closed, hospitals were only ensuring emergency care, local authorities were paralysed and airports and ports were expected to be badly affected.
					
					 Striking workers picketed public sector buildings in central London.
					
					 Trade unionists joined the largest strike seen in Britain for at least 30 years on Wednesday.

articles.title: Seminario cientifico sobre sistema de produccion circular
articles.content:
Seminario cientifico sobre sistema de produccion circular

					Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Bajo auspicios del Comite Central de la Federacion General de Ciencia y Tecnica de Corea, tuvo lugar desde el 29 de noviembre hasta el 2 de diciembre en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el seminario cientifico de la rama agricola sobre el sistema de produccion circular con la participacion de los cientificos, tecnicos y funcionarios de la rama agricola, ganadera, fruticola, sericicola, etc. 
					
					En la ocasion hubo discursos sobre los problemas tecnicos que se presentan en establecer el sistema de produccion circular entre la ganaderia y la agricultura, los metodos de produccion de abonos compuestos organicos, etc. 
					
					Los oradores se refirieron a los exitos logrados por varias unidades del pais en el proceso de establecer el sistema de produccion circular. 
					
					En el marco del certamen se realizaron la presentacion cientifico-tecnica y la exhibicion de productos tecnicos agricolas. 
					
					De entre las disertaciones de estudio presentados se han publicado mas de 200 exitos logrados en la investigacion cientifica y la innovacion tecnica y fueron expuestos los productos de nueva tecnologia de mas de 80 generos. 
					
					Se realizaron la propaganda de ciencia y tecnica y el intercambio de nuevas tecnologias y las visitas a las unidades ejemplares.

articles.title: RPDC esta dispuesta a aniquilar a los enemigos
articles.content:
RPDC esta dispuesta a aniquilar a los enemigos

					Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ACNC) -- "Nuestras fuerzas armadas revolucionarias estan totalmente dispuestas a hacer frente a cualesquier  provocaciones militares", esta informacion de la Comandancia Suprema del Ejercito Popular de Corea, publicada el pasado dia 24, aumenta al ejercito y el pueblo de Corea el impetu de aniquilar despiadadamente a los belicistas de la capa militar del Sur de Corea enloquecidos por la confrontacion fratricida y a los imperialistas norteamericanos.
					
					Rodong Sinmun, Minju Joson y otros periodicos centrales difunden diariamente los articulos de denuncia a la banda titere que en vez de sacar las lecciones merecidas con motivo del primer aniversario del caso de canonazos en la isla de Yonphyong, libro los ejercicios de guerra anti-RPDC de gran envergadura imputando a la RPDC la responsabilidad por el respecto. 
					
					Se ven a menudo en la pantalla de TV la informacion de la Comandancia Suprema del EPC y el documental alusivo a los ejercicios conjuntos de las fuerzas terrestres, navales y aereas del EPC.
					
					"El poderio de nuestro ejercito es inimaginable", "En esta tierra no hay ninguna fuerza capaz de detener nuestro  golpe" y "Es firme nuestro coraje", asi dijeron los ciudadanos despues de verlo.
					
					Se ven en las fabricas, empresas, granjas cooperativas y campos de construccion las tablillas de noticias que exhortan a trabajadores a acelerar la produccion y la construccion con el temperamento combativo de aniquilar de un golpe a la banda traidora del Sur de Corea.
					
					Pagaran muy caro los belicistas desafiantes al inagotable poderio del EPC y a la unidad monolitica de todo el ejercito y el pueblo coreanos en torno a la Direccion de la Revolucion.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia fortalecimiento de "alianza"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia fortalecimiento de "alianza"

					Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En un articulo individual difundido este viernes, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala que la banda conservadora del Sur de Corea sera repudiada por toda la nacion coreana por el fortalecimiento de la "alianza" con las fuerzas extranjeras y por sus actos serviles proyanquis.
					
					El fortalecimiento de la "alianza" con las fuerzas extranjeras a que recurren las autoridades surcoreanas es un acto traidor que vende la dignidad e interes de los habitantes y un crimen antinacional que destruye las relaciones intercoreanas y trae el peligro de guerra en la Peninsula Coreana, comienza el articulo y continua:
					
					La banda conservada dice como si la "alianza" con Estados Unidos le beneficiara algo, pero esto no pasa de ser una charlataneria para ocultar su naturaleza traidora.
					
					Las fuerzas en el poder del Sur de Corea aceptaron todas las demandas bandidescas de su amo norteamericano para realizar el "tratado de libre comercio" con este, describiendolo como un pacto para fortalecer la "alianza economica". Y se comprometieron a "luchar en pro de los intereses de EE.UU.".
					
					En el trasfondo de esta maniobra esta ocultada la malsana intencion de mantener el "poder" y pasar sin dificultad la ultima etapa de su mandato obteniendo el apoyo de su amo y vendiendo hasta los intereses de los habitantes surcoreanos.
					
					Tambien el fortalecimiento de la "alianza" con EE.UU. es para realizar la politica conflictiva anti-RPDC bajo el amparo del imperio.
					
					Mientras que las autoridades surcoreanas excluyen a los connacionales y fortalecen de continuo la "alianza" y la cooperacion anti-RPDC con EE.UU., no pueden ser mejoradas las relaciones intercoreanas ni eliminado el peligro de estallido de la guerra nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Por mas que las autoridades surcoreanas recurran al fortalecimiento de la "alianza" con EE.UU., se revelara mas la naturaleza antinacional de si mismas y los traidores no podran evadir la severa sentencia de la poblacion indignada y seran arruinados.

articles.title: Minju Joson revela intencion de "GPN" en aprobacion del TLC
articles.content:
Minju Joson revela intencion de "GPN" en aprobacion del TLC

					Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El periodico Minju Joson divulgo en su edicion de este viernes un comentario individual senalando que el "Tratado de Libre Comercio" (TLC) es igual a la condena a muerte para los habitantes surcoreanos. 
					
					El tratado esta penetrado por el contenido avasallante y vendepatria tendente a intensificar la dominacion colonial y la subyugacion de EE.UU. sobre el suelo surcoreano, destaca el comentario y continua: 
					
					La vigencia del TLC beneficia no a la poblacion surcoreana, sino a las fuerzas extranjeras y al "poder" conservador y la minoria de plutocratas financieros del Sur de Corea. 
					
					Entonces, ?por que los compinches del "Gran Partido Nacional" aprobaron de modo forzado el "proyecto de consentimiento de aprobacion del Tratado de Libre Comercio" que ocasionara el repudio de las masas?
					
					Como es conocido por todos, el "GPN" esta en aprieto muy critico. Se alzan las voces de los habitantes de distintos estratos en demanda de someter al juicio al "gobierno" conservador por su politica antipopular. Por otra parte, tras fracasarse en  las elecciones de alcalde de Seul dentro del "GPN" no cesan las disputas entre los grupos bajo el rotulo de la "reforma". 
					
					En esta circunstancia, si EE.UU. le da espaldas al "GPN", este no tendra donde apoyarse, 
					
					Pues, aprobo en la "Asamblea Nacional" el "proyecto de consentimiento de aprobacion del Tratado de Libre Comercio" con el objetivo de evadir la crisis de dominacion y realizar la ambicion de retomar el poder ganando el apoyo de su amo norteamericano. 
					
					Mientras que los traidores vendepatrias colmados de servilismo a los yanquis tomen el poder, la poblacion surcoreana no podra liberarse nunca de la dominacion y subyugacion de las fuerzas extranjeras, sino sufrira aun mas sufrimientos y desgracias.
